course.title: PSY 4173 Seminar in Cognitive Psychology Research (3 units)
course.desc: In this seminar, students undertake an extensive examination of theoretical problems in the fields of vision, spatial processing, learning, memory, attention, object recognition, or face recognition. Critical examination of scientific literature dealing with these topics and proposition of research strategies that would provide solutions to these theoretical problems.Course Component: SeminarPrerequisite: 81 university units including PSY 1101, PSY 1102, PSY 2174, PSY 3377. Reserved for students registered in the Major, Joint Honours and Honours programs in psychology.
